definitions.definition: To attack (a person) on his or her blind side.
examples: The robbers crept out of the forest and blindsided the traveller.

definitions.definition: To catch off guard ; to take by surprise .
examples: He had completed his plan to develop a new office building, but was blindsided by the sudden drop in real estate values.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To attack (a person) on his or her blind side.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative , informal ) To catch off guard ; to take by surprise .
